name: Banyan Tree Mayakoba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been at the best resorts in the world, and this by far was the most superior. In fact, nothing else even gets close. I had read all the reviews and was very excited to visit, however, I had such high expectations that I was almost afraid that I would be disappointed. We could not have been more in awe. My husband and I are big golfers and we brought our clubs to golf at Mayakoba. They never saw the light of day. We fell so in love with our villa that we never wanted to leave. Other than breakfast and dinner, we were in our villa ALL day. We stayed in a spa villa and I cannot even begin to describe how amazing it was. The pool was huge and the jacuzzi was great and used every night.
reviews.title: It does NOT get any better than this. Seriously.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The architects of this truly special and unique place thought of everything. Even down to the exact angles of the layout of the villas. We spent a lot of time not completely clothed and there was no way that the villas beside us could see us. Other than the periodic boat going by, it was so secluded. And the natural surrounding beauty was breathtaking.
reviews.title: I found heaven on earth!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom, bathroom, outside showers (2), outside bathtub, steam room and extra living room villa could not have been any more elegant. They literally thought of everything. From the i-phone/pod players, incense, coffee maker, tea, fabulous lighting both inside and out, fresh fruit, fresh flowers, etc., I could keep going forever.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort & Excellent Service

reviews.text: The food was amazing. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic and HUGE. Anything you could ever want is there. And they change it every day. We had dinner at Safron which was excellent. We also tried the BBQ by the pool and that was great as well.
reviews.title: Best Resort in the Americas
All I can say is "WOW!"
reviews.text: When we did venture out we used the bikes and had a great time. It was such a unique offering they provided. We loved it. It was a great way to see the beautiful surroundings/landscaping of the resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Travel Snob has met his match. This is it my friends of the five star, the Banyan Tree Mayakoba is a stunning resort in every way. Like other reviewers let me urge you to get the Half Off Best of the BTMK while you still can. Its is the best travel deal going and the word is getting out. After 5 glorious days I can tell you I'll be happy just to get a reservation in the future.
reviews.title: The Banyan Tree Mayakoba raises the bar for Beach Resorts in The Americas.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think of myself as a critical reviewer as I believe vacation time is a precious thing and we deerve the best at leisure time.....we are paying for it after all. But, its hard to not to gush as others have about this amazing resort. I've attached pictures of the villa, which is the most amazing thing about BTMK, but her goes:
reviews.title: Stunning property, stunning service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those of us who don't get a chance to travel to Asia to experience some of these amazing resorts, I think the Banyan Tree and hopefully the Viceroy; coming next door at this location on the Mexican Riveiera, will raise the bar to this level of accomodation.
reviews.title: Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Accomodations:
reviews.title: The staff takes this romantic resort above & beyond 5 stars

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights in a Courtyard Pool Villa and 2 nights in a Spa Villa.
reviews.title: Banyan Tree Mayakoba- the new FS Hualalai???

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the BT Mayakoba for four nights & upgraded ourselves from the Garden Villa to the Courtyard Villa. We could not be more pleased with our decision.
reviews.title: I would visit again in a heartbeat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom and bathroom is in one pavilion, while the living area is in the other pavilion with a courtyard/pool/spa/garden that separates the two pavilions.
reviews.title: Amazing place, great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We truly enjoy the fact that each villa has it's own privacy. Even though it's facing the lagoon and we have an unobstructed view of the mangroves, we got used to walking around in our birthday suite without fearing that anyone else will see us. jSorry for the mental image, believe me, you'll be tempted to do the same thing! Having the luxury of swimming at any hour in the privacy of our own villa is priceless.
reviews.title: Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also enjoyed free wi-fi and the free bike rentals (highly recommend). Each morning we would bike around the complex, to the beach and around the golf course to work up an appetite for the free daily buffet.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Occupancy was only around 30% and we definitely felt that the resort's staffs out-numbered the guests. Bottom line, we felt we were being treated as royalties, staffs greeted us by name. I would come back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY**** GO BEFORE IT GOES UP

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I have traveled to Playa del Carmen/Riviera Maya approximately 6 times in the last 2 years so we know this area pretty well. The last time we came here, we stayed at the Rosewood (also in the Mayakoba) and we thought it couldn't get any better. We initially thought about staying at the Rosewood again, but decided to stay at the newly opened Banyan Tree to try something different. We really didn't think it could get much better than the Rosewood - boy were we wrong. Both resorts are 5-star and you can't go wrong staying at either place, but the Banyan Tree is just a step above.
reviews.title: Unforgettable, Luxurious, and Amazing

reviews.text: The villas - One of the main differences between the villas at the Rosewood and the Banyan Tree are the private pools that accompany each villa. The pool at the Rosewood is small and is not that inviting. The private pool with our villa was a HUGE endless pool that was surrounded by beautiful landscaping and several lounging areas. Some of the villas come with a hot tub which I would highly recommend you upgrade to. It's just nice to come home from dinner or a day at the beach and soak in the hot tub.
reviews.title: The Best of the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at the Banyan Tree is excellent. The main restaurant, called Saffron, serves Thai food and they have actually staffed world class chefs, restaurant managers, waitresses from Thailand so it feels like a truly authentic experience. The restaurant itself is so beautiful and romantic. There are 3 main seating areas, 2 outdoor and 1 indoor if you would rather sit in air conditioning. I recommend sitting outdoor overtop the lagoon. It just creates an unforgettable dining experience. We couldn't get enough of the food from Tamarind, the hotel's other main restaurant. Our first night there, we had the pleasure of meeting Christian Roth, the Food and Beverage director of Tamarind and the hotel bar, La Copa. He set up a special tasting menu for us with fantastic wines from Mexico. We rated it as one of the top meals we have ever had (almost better than Laserre in Paris!). We loved it so much that we even had dinner at Tamarind a second night with Christian. We had friends in town so he set up a beautiful dinner for us in their private banquet room called La Cava (where they served the president of Mexico when he attended the opening of the hotel) which is room where they also store their wines. We were treated with a brand new tasting menu with specially selected wines from Christian. Needless to say, it was amazing!
reviews.title: Five Star in Every Way -- Including the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa - The spa at Rosewood doesn't even compare to the spa at the Banyan Tree. And before the Rosewood, I didn't think I could ever find a nicer spa. The service is unbelievable. We scheduled a swedish and balinese massage. In addition to our massages, they give you a footbath, facial massage, head massage, and refreshments. Our 60 minute massage was 90 minutes of absolute bliss. We were tempted to go back for a second round the next day but didn't have time. They also have this amazing facility called the Rain Forest. We didn't have time to experience it, but we heard it is a must.
reviews.title: incredible service

reviews.text: The staff - they remember who you are from the minute you walk in to the minute you walk out. Everywhere we went, we were greeted by name (they even remembered how to pronounce my name which no one ever does). They are above and beyond attentive. At one point while I was on the beach, I asked one of the attendants the time because I didn't have a watch and every time he saw me after, he would tell me the time. If they are that attentive about small things like this, imagine how they are about everything else.
reviews.title: This will become one of the best resorts- catch it now

aka: Banyan Tree Mayakoba Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: A harmonious blend of nature and luxury, Banyan Tree Mayakoba takes resort living to new heights with the first all-pool villa resort in Riviera Maya, Mexico. Banyan Tree Hotels and Resorts brings Asian hospitality to the beautiful development of Mayakoba, Riviera Maya, complete with Banyan Tree Mayakoba pool villas offering premium seclusion and an expansive Mayakoba spa complex with the introduction of the award-winning Banyan Tree Mayakoba Spa.
